comment.author: 74978609@N03
comment._content: People posting such vilifying comments about Stalin don't have enough historical facts. So they are easily biased by the capitalist propaganda. I am sure many of them are innocent victims of the propaganda machinery comprising the mainstream media, both print and electronic, which can even sway popular opinion in favor of war, regime change and occupation. If anybody sincerely wants to know about Stalin can contact me, not waste their precious life reading trash. A lot of resource of the world has been wasted in making sick movies and writing sick books to tarnish his image. However, I see Stalin as the greatest statesman and military strategist of 20th century. His contribution to world peace and progress is unprecedented. His is a man of outstanding revolutionary character and commitment. Many undesirable things happened during his 30 years of leadership. He knows that and all sincere Communists know that. But you have to consider the task he had undertaken. The goals of socialism that the Communists had set. And the global capitalist and imperialist states were conspiring and directly working to destroy the Soviet Union. His fight was not just against Hitler. He was fighting the combined forces of global captilasim and imperialism to save a revolutionary state. He was leading a fight against combined army of 3 million that Hitler and his lackeys had set against the Soviet Union. He was fighting both internally and externally the enemies who were working to reinstate Tsardom and take the Soviet people to a past of ignominious slavery. He stood firm to protect the sacrifice of countless farmers, workers and academicians who were sweating to bring cheer to the life of the people oppressed for centuries. He himself had said that only by a modern industrial economy and modernized agriculture they could face the threats. And he did that exactly. So the people who are picking his mistakes or crime! must question the capitalist governments why they forced Stalin to fight a war at all, why a war was necessary at all. What wrong the Soviet people had done. Stalin with his limited means at that time did everything possible to avoid the war, first diplomatically, even by agreeing to humiliating conditions set by the enemies. But finally, when all the means were exhausted and the so-called champions of freedom and democracy(UK,USA and France) were not ready to help him(but pretending to be allies), he had to fight. This war of unprecedented barbarism had its effect on internal security in the Soviet society. You have to first ask your Capitalist governments why such a monster as Hitler was created first with active financial and military help from capitalists and imperialists. Isn't it to crush a revolutionary state which would expose their crimes and exploitation and encourage revolution in their own countries? Make sure you have reasonable answer to these questions before you go picking Stalin's mistakes. visit: www.suci-c.in/intro/about/about.htm
